channel.title: Is bad spelling infecting the internets? Are YOU affected?
channel.description:
Lately, I've been completely flooded with horrible spelling. OK, so retarded 8 year old kids can do it. That's OK.. But now, it's been seeping into pretty much everything on the internet, even professional content: * There was a "it's"/"its" mistake on the [url=http://ars.userfriendly.org/]Userfriendly comic strip[/url] recently. * [url=http://www.theinquirer.net/default.aspx]The Inquirer[/url] also often contains spelling errors of this nature, but only within the past year or so. * There are some games like [url=http://www.poxnora.com/index.do]Pox Nora[/url] with such spelling errors in the "rune" descriptions. * Runescape has also had its fair share of spelling problems until they supposedly implemented a spelling checker for their overworked and uneducated quest peons.
One day, I fear that I'll wake up and the President's letter to the Wall Street Journal is going to be full of l33t mixed in with crude phonetic spelling.
Discuss.

item.title: Is bad spelling infecting the internets? Are YOU affected?
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

[quote=“IcyPimp, post:27, topic:45425”][quote author=bullzeye link=topic=63139.msg749764#msg749764 date=1168231705]

It’s not peoples fault if they can’t spell or have really bad grammer
[/quote]Actually it is. They should('ve) payed (or is it paid?) more attention in school.

Paid.[/quote]Alright, thanks. That one always did get me.

Read full topic

item.title: Is bad spelling infecting the internets? Are YOU affected?
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

Oh yeh you said internets not internet. You also capitalized “YOU” when it should be “you”. and it should be:

Is bad spelling infecting the internet, are you affected?

item.source: Is bad spelling infecting the internets? Are YOU affected?

item.title: Is bad spelling infecting the internets? Are YOU affected?
item.dc:creator: @SaveSomeFace SaveSomeFace
item.description:
@SaveSomeFace wrote:

Many people are infected…
I don’t think it’s acceptable at all in mass media.
It’s kind of annoying, but I don’t mind if people leave apostrophes out of contractions (excluding its/it’s).
My least favorite is the your/you’re mistake.
“Your welcome.”
Oh… so it’s MY welcome?

Read full topic
